Detailed Description

Internal interface base class for direct access to the OBEX layer.

Warning;
This is an internal interface and must not be used outside APOXI at all.

It must be implemented by all transport adapters, hence developers of transport adapters for APOXI OBEX will need to understand the concepts explained in the following paragraphs:

Outbound client requests and server responses.

Outbound requests to the protocol stack are represented by public abstract methods, which must be implemented by each transport adapter module. Class ObexProtocol defines the transport-level interface with operations related to opening an closing a physical connection, while ObexLayer extends it to support OBEX operations over that transport abstraction.

Inbound client responses and server requests.

Inbound requests from the protocol stack must be handled by calling the appropriate protected On<event_occured> methods. These methods execute in the context of the caller, which is mostly a stack callback function. The caller may safely assume that no application software functions are ever directly invoked from this context. Instead, the server registry is checked to verify if there is a server capable of handling the request. If yes, an ObexMsg is sent which is later received by an ObexDispatcher running in an ExecutionContext of APOXI. If not, the request is immediately rejected by synchronously sending an error response from the context of the caller, and no message is sent.

OBEX Operations.

An OBEX operation is composed from at least one Request-Response pair followed by OnComplete() being invoked to indicate the end of the operation. OBEX PUT and GET operations may (and usually will) involve multiple request-response pairs, while the simple OBEX operations CONNECT, DISCONNECT, and SETPATH each utilize exactly one request-response pair.

See also:
ObexProtocol
Please don't forget to feed the transport interface inherited from ObexProtocol, especially the OnComplete() method which must be called on completion of every OBEX- and transport operation.

Member Function Documentation

virtual void ObexLayer::Abort (  const ObexChannel &  client_chan,
ObexOperationId  oper_id,
const ObexObject &  abort_req
)  [pure virtual]
 

Aborts an ongoing OBEX client operation.

Only a currently pending PUT or GET operation can be aborted, and only clients may issue ABORT requests.

Parameters:
client_chan Client channel associated with the request.
oper_id Operation identifier of the operation to be aborted
abort_req OBEX object which holds the headers to be included in the ABORT request.

Implemented in StreamObexImpl, BtObexImpl, and IrdaObexImpl.

virtual void ObexLayer::Connect (  const ObexChannel &  client_chan,
ObexOperationId  oper_id,
const ObexObject &  conn_req
)  [pure virtual]
 

Starts an OBEX CONNECT operation.

The channel must be a valid client channel in state 'OPEN'.

See also:
OpenClientChannel(). The result is delivered asynchronously by means of a call to OnResponse().

OnResponse()

Parameters:
client_chan Client channel associated with the request.
oper_id Operation identifier
conn_req OBEX object which holds the headers to be included in the CONNECT request and flags according to OBEX Spec. 3.3.1.2, but no data !

Implemented in StreamObexImpl, BtObexImpl, and IrdaObexImpl.

virtual void ObexLayer::DataProcessed (  const ObexChannel &  channel,
ObexOperationId  oper_id,
ObexBuffer &  obex_buffer
)  [pure virtual]
 

Confirm processing of data delivered to an application.

By calling this method the application layer returns the ownership of a buffer back to the protocol implementation which had produced the buffer and therefore knows how to dispose it.

Implemented in StreamObexImpl, BtObexImpl, and IrdaObexImpl.

virtual void ObexLayer::Disconnect (  const ObexChannel &  client_chan,
ObexOperationId  oper_id,
const ObexObject &  disc_req
)  [pure virtual]
 

Starts an OBEX DISCONNECT operation.

Parameters:
client_chan Client channel associated with the request.
oper_id Operation identifier
disc_req OBEX object which holds the headers to be included in the DISCONNECT request.

Implemented in StreamObexImpl, BtObexImpl, and IrdaObexImpl.

virtual void ObexLayer::Get (  const ObexChannel &  client_chan,
ObexOperationId  oper_id,
const ObexObject &  get_req
)  [pure virtual]
 

Starts or continues an OBEX GET operation.

Note that in rare cases a GET request may contain a BODY header !

Parameters:
client_chan Client channel associated with the request.
oper_id Operation identifier.
get_req OBEX object which holds the headers to be included in the GET request and possibly BODY data within an ObexBuffer.

Implemented in StreamObexImpl, BtObexImpl, and IrdaObexImpl.

void ObexLayer::OnAbort (  const ObexChannel &  server_chan,
ObexOperationId  oper_id,
const ObexObject &  abort_req,
ObexServerId  server_id = ObexServerInfo::NoServerId
)  [protected]
 

Indicates abort of an ongoing OBEX operation to a server.

This method must be called by the protocol implementation to indicate that the remote client has ordered an abort of the current operation. The channel must be a valid server channel.

See also:
OpenServerChannel(). The result of the operation is delivered asynchronously by means of a call to ReturnResponse().

ReturnResponse(). In order to avoid race conditions when the first PUT or GET request has been indicated to ObexLayer but not yet been dispatched by the application layer, it is advisable to store the ServerId returned by OnPut() and OnGet() for each channel within the transport implementation and include it when calling OnAbort().

Parameters:
server_chan Server channel associated with the request.
oper_id Operation identifier of the operation to be aborted
abort_req OBEX object which holds the headers included in the ABORT request.
server_id ObexServerId returned by a preceeding OnPut() or OnGet() of the operation to be aborted.

void ObexLayer::OnConnect (  const ObexChannel &  server_chan,
ObexOperationId  oper_id,
const ObexObject &  conn_req
)  [protected]
 

Forwards an incoming OBEX CONNECT request to a server.

This method must be called by the protocol implementation to indicate an incoming CONNECT request to a server. The channel must be a valid server channel.

See also:
OpenServerChannel(). The result of the operation is delivered asynchronously by means of a call to ReturnResponse().

ReturnResponse() An ObexOperationId must be assigned using ObexOperationId::Create() !

Parameters:
server_chan Server channel associated with the request.
oper_id Operation identifier (issued by implementation)
conn_req OBEX object which holds the headers included in the CONNECT request and flags according to OBEX Spec. 3.3.1.2, but no data !

void ObexLayer::OnDataProcessed (  const ObexChannel &  channel,
ObexOperationId  oper_id,
ObexBuffer &  app_buffer
)  [protected]
 

Confirms processing of data supplied by an application.

By calling this method the protocol implementation returns the ownership of a buffer back to the application layer which had produced the buffer and therefore knows how to dispose it.

Parameters:
channel ObexChannel the operation is running on.
oper_id Operation identifier of the operation the buffer is associated with.
app_buffer ObexBuffer to be returned to the application layer.

void ObexLayer::OnDisconnect (  const ObexChannel &  server_chan,
ObexOperationId  oper_id,
const ObexObject &  disc_req
)  [protected]
 

Forwards an incoming OBEX DISCONNECT request to a server.

This method must be called by the protocol implementation to indicate an incoming DISCONNECT request to a server. The channel must be a valid server channel.

See also:
OpenServerChannel(). The result of the operation is delivered asynchronously by means of a call to ReturnResponse().

ReturnResponse() An ObexOperationId must be assigned using ObexOperationId::Create() !

Parameters:
server_chan Server channel associated with the request.
oper_id Operation identifier (issued by implementation)
conn_req OBEX object which holds the headers included in the DISCONNECT request, but no data !

ObexServerId ObexLayer::OnGet (  const ObexChannel &  server_chan,
ObexOperationId  oper_id,
const ObexObject &  get_req
)  [protected]
 

Forwards an incoming OBEX GET request to a server.

This method must be called by the protocol implementation to indicate an incoming GET request to a server. The channel must be a valid server channel.

See also:
OpenServerChannel(). The result of the operation is delivered asynchronously by means of a call to ReturnResponse().

ReturnResponse()

For each GET operation, an ObexOperationId must be assigned using ObexOperationId::Create() !. If one GET operation comprises multiple requests, the following requests must use the same operation id as the first one (therefore it seems wise to save the operation id until the operation is complete !).

Parameters:
server_chan Server channel associated with the request.
oper_id Operation identifier (issued by implementation)
get_req OBEX object which holds the headers included in the GET request and possibly (in rare cases) BODY data within an ObexBuffer.
Returns:
ObexServerId of the server which is going to handle the request or NoServerId when no suitable server was found. In the latter case, ReturnResponse() is called synchronously from this function indicating an error.

ObexServerId ObexLayer::OnPut (  const ObexChannel &  server_chan,
ObexOperationId  oper_id,
const ObexObject &  put_req
)  [protected]
 

Forwards an incoming OBEX PUT request to a server.

This method must be called by the protocol implementation to indicate an incoming PUT request to a server. The channel must be a valid server channel.

See also:
OpenServerChannel(). The result of the operation is delivered asynchronously by means of a call to ReturnResponse().

ReturnResponse()

For each PUT operation, an ObexOperationId must be assigned using ObexOperationId::Create() !. If one PUT operation comprises multiple requests, the following requests must use the same operation id as the first one (therefore it seems wise to save the operation id until the operation is complete !).

Parameters:
server_chan Server channel associated with the request.
oper_id Operation identifier (issued by implementation)
put_req OBEX object which holds the headers included in the PUT request and possibly BODY data within an ObexBuffer.
Returns:
ObexServerId of the server which is going to handle the request or NoServerId when no suitable server was found. In the latter case, ReturnResponse() is called synchronously from this function indicating an error.

void ObexLayer::OnResponse (  const ObexChannel &  client_chan,
ObexOperationId  oper_id,
const ObexObject &  server_resp
)  [protected]
 

Returns an OBEX response to a client.

This method is used by protocol implementations for specific transports which derive their implementation from this base class. It should be called to deliver OBEX responses returned by a remote OBEX server.

Parameters:
client_chan Client channel associated with the response.
oper_id Operation identifier (same as in request).
server_resp OBEX object holding headers, a response code and possibly BODY data within an ObexBuffer returned by the remote server.

void ObexLayer::OnSetPath (  const ObexChannel &  server_chan,
ObexOperationId  oper_id,
const ObexObject &  setp_req
)  [protected]
 

Forwards an incoming OBEX SETPATH request to a server.

This method must be called by the protocol implementation to indicate an incoming SETPATH request to a server. The channel must be a valid server channel.

See also:
OpenServerChannel(). The result of the operation is delivered asynchronously by means of a call to ReturnResponse().

ReturnResponse() An ObexOperationId must be assigned using ObexOperationId::Create() !

Parameters:
server_chan Server channel associated with the request.
oper_id Operation identifier (issued by implementation)
setp_req OBEX object which holds the headers included in the SETPATH request and flags according to OBEX Spec. 3.3.6.1, but no data !

ObexOperationId  oper_id,
const ObexObject &  put_req
)  [pure virtual]

Parameters:
client_chan Client channel associated with the request.
oper_id Operation identifier
put_req OBEX object which holds the headers to be included in the PUT request and possibly BODY data within an ObexBuffer.

Implemented in StreamObexImpl, BtObexImpl, and IrdaObexImpl.

virtual void ObexLayer::ReturnResponse (  const ObexChannel &  server_chan,
ObexOperationId  oper_id,
const ObexObject &  server_resp
)  [pure virtual]
 

Sends a response to a client request.

Parameters:
server_chan Server channel associated with the response.
oper_id Operation identifier of the request to respond to (it was passed along with the request).
server_resp OBEX object which holds the headers to be included in the response, the response code and possibly BODY data within an ObexBuffer.

Implemented in StreamObexImpl, BtObexImpl, and IrdaObexImpl.

ObexOperationId  oper_id,
const ObexObject &  setp_req
)  [pure virtual]

oper_id Operation identifier
setp_req OBEX object which holds the headers to be included in the SETPATH request and flags according to OBEX Spec. 3.3.6.1, but no data !

Implemented in StreamObexImpl, BtObexImpl, and IrdaObexImpl.
